exercises.question: What is the primary goal of 'managing up'?
options: To tell your manager what to do.
To consciously work with your boss to achieve the best results for everyone.
To avoid doing work by delegating it to your boss.
To complain about your manager to higher authorities.

exercises.question: Which leadership trait involves identifying needs before they are explicitly requested?
The manager persuaded IT to fix the server. (The manager got...)
exercises.answer: The manager got IT to fix the server.

exercises.question: What does it mean to 'loop someone in'?
options: To fire someone from the team.
To include someone in a discussion or email thread.
To make someone repeat a task.

exercises.title: Email: Providing a Briefing
exercises.description: Your manager is traveling to a conference. You have already 'had the flights booked' and 'got the marketing team to provide' the presentation. Write an update email to your manager summarizing these actions. Use at least two causative structures.
exercises.sampleAnswer:
Subject: Update: Briefing pack and travel arrangements for the conference

Dear Robert,

I hope you're having a good morning.

I wanted to provide a quick update on your arrangements for the upcoming conference. I have already **had the flights and accommodation booked**; you should receive the confirmation emails shortly. 

Additionally, I **got the marketing team to provide** the final version of the presentation slides, which I have included in the attached briefing pack. I have also **had the hard copies printed** and placed them on your desk.

I will touch base with you tomorrow to see if there is anything else you need before you head off.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
